oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Whig's Defeat quilt
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Red and white Whig's Defeat quilt. The quilt was found in a house built by Daniel Cleage. A label on the back of the quilt reads "Mrs. C. A. Beard, Athens, Tennessee." A single letter E is stitched on the quilt top in black thread. C. A. Beard's first wife was named Eliza. Flower basket cornucopias can be seen in the white space on the quilt. They have been worked in trapunto style.
